contentrichtext.text: {{Japanese city | Name = Honjō | JapaneseName=本庄 | official_name= 本庄市 · Honjō | settlement_type= [[City]] | ImageSkyline= | ImageSize= | ImageCaption= | MapImage=Honjo in Saitama Prefecture Ja.svg | Prefecture=[[Saitama Prefecture|Saitama]] | Region=[[Kanto region|Kanto]] | Area_km2=89.71 | Population=81,267 | PopDate=May 1, 2011 | Density_km2=905.89 | Coords= | LatitudeDegrees = 36 | LatitudeMinutes = 14 | LatitudeSeconds = 36 | LongtitudeDegrees = 139 | LongtitudeMinutes = 11 | LongtitudeSeconds = 25 | Postal code= | Area code= | Mayor = Shinge Yoshida (since July 2005) | Tree =[[Osmanthus]] | Flower =Oenothera tetraptera (''Tsukimiso'' is [[Japan]]ese) | Bird = | SymbolImage= Flag of Honjo Saitama.JPG | SymbolDescription= Flag | CityHallPostalCode = 367-8501 | CityHallAddress= 3-5-3 Honjo, Honjo-shi, Saitama-ken | CityHallPhone= 0495-25-1111 | CityHallLink = [http://www.city.honjo.saitama.jp/ Honjō] | CityMap= Honjo in Saitama Prefecture Ja.svg | Elevation= }} {{Nihongo|'''Honjō'''|本庄市|Honjō-shi}} is a [[cities of Japan|city]] located in [[Saitama Prefecture]], Japan. As of May 1, 2011, the city has an estimated [[population]] of 81,267, with 32,685 [[households]] and a [[population density]] of 905.89 persons per km². The total area is 89.71 km². The city was founded on July 1, 1954. On January 10, 2006 the town of [[Kodama, Saitama|Kodama]] was merged into Honjō. ==Transportation== * [[Honjō Station (Saitama)|Honjō Station]] ([[East Japan Railway Company|JR East]] [[Takasaki Line]]) * [[Honjō-Waseda Station]] (JR East [[Jōetsu Shinkansen]]) * National Road Route 17 ==Entertainment== * Honjō Circuit, a small motorsports circuit ==Sister cities== Honjō is [[town twinning|twinned]] with: * {{flagicon|Japan}} [[Kazo, Saitama]], Japan * {{flagicon|Japan}} [[Shibukawa, Gunma]], Japan ==External links== * [http://www.city.honjo.lg.jp/ Honjō official website] {{ja icon}} {{Saitama}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Honjo, Saitama}} [[Category:Cities in Saitama Prefecture]] {{Saitama-geo-stub}}
